results.title: The Good Food Cookbook
results.brief_description: The Good Food Cookbook will not only show you how to master all those cooking techniques which recipes never seem to explain, but also give you hundreds of practical tips and hints so that you can both buy, prepare and cook food so much more easily and enjoyably. Rated: G

results.title: The Gondoliers or the King of Barataria
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather and Judith de Paul
results.brief_description: Marco and Guiseppe Palmien are two Venetian gondoliers, one of whom is also the rightful King of Barataria. Since no one knows which of them was abducted from the kingdom as a child, they have a chance to put their republican principles into practice by sharing the throne … until it is revealed that in fact neither of them is truly king. Performers include: Keith Michell, Eric Shilling, Francis Edgerton, Tom Mc Donnell, Nan Christie, Anne Collins, Sandra Dugdale. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by Peter Wood. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.

results.title: The Golden years of TV comedy 1975
results.brief_description: Three comedy classics from 1975 interspersed with original news clips on the year’s major events. In “Porridge - Just desserts” this classic episode of what is arguably the greatest British sitcom ever, Ronnie Barker stars as the cynical, prison-weary Fletcher who utters the immortal line ‘there is a thief among us’ as his pilfered tin of pineapple chunks goes missing. “Sykes” has been described as the first great BBC sitcom. This famous episode finds Eric Sykes, Hattie Jacques and Deryck Guyler on holiday in Germany with Eric still keen to remind his hosts just who won the war! “The Two Ronnies”, for 17 years they ruled the comedy roost. This show, from their mid-1970’s peak contains all the favourite ingredients.

results.title: The Golden ring
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, BBC-TV and Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen
results.brief_description: An impression of the enormous musical and technical resources which went into the recording of “Gotterdammerung”, the latest chapter in an ambitious project to record Wagner’s entire Ring Cycle. With actual takes of the Immolation scene, Siegfried’s Funeral March and the ‘Vengeance’ trio which ends Act II, and behind the scenes film of rehearsals, playbacks, recordings, and interviews with some of the principal artists. Singers include Birgit Nilsson, Wolfgang Windgasson, Gottlob Frick, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau, Clare Watson. Conductor - Georg Solti.

results.title: The Golden land: 1840s-1900
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
This film examines the period of Australian history, 1840-1900, that included the Gold-rush years and the farming boom.

results.title: The Golden Jubilee of the CRB: Victoria 1913-1963
results.brief_description: Depicts 50 years of progress in road and bridge construction in Victoria. The first survey made in 1913 showed that travel was hazardous on the hand-made roads. In 1916 the first all-weather road to Geelong was completed. Gradually isolated settlers and mailmen were able to travel in the country. Municipal co-operation was sought and aid given for road construction by machines. Recent work includes new concrete bridges, and the completion of a two-lane highway from Melbourne to Dandenong, all important to Victoria’s prosperity. During 50 years, motor registrations increased from 10,000 to 90,000.

results.title: The Golden gate
results.brief_description: Members of the United Nations celebrate the tenth anniversary of the signing of the United Nations Charter in San Francisco in 1945. An interesting historical perspective in the Cold War era containing speeches from Eisenhower, McMillan, and Molotov.

results.title: The Golden fish
results.creator_credit: Edmond Sechan and Jacques Cousteau Productions
results.brief_description: The story of a young boy who joyfully brings home his new pet. During the boy’s absence, the goldfish leaps out of his bowl, and is confronted by a sinister looking black cat who unexpectedly tosses the fish back into the bowl. Story by Roger Mauge. No dialogue.
